questions.questiontxt: Write a function that calculates the factorial of a number. Example: factorial(5) should return 120
questions.howtoapproach: Use either recursion or iteration. The recursive approach is elegant but iteration is more efficient. Think about base cases and how the number decreases with each call/iteration.

questions.questiontxt: Given an array of integers, find two numbers that add up to a target sum.
constraints: Each input has exactly one solution
You cannot use the same element twice
questions.howtoapproach: Use a hash map to store numbers you've seen. For each number, check if (target - current_number) exists in the map. This gives O(n) time complexity.
